Tijs Teulings
Tijs is a technologist and partner at Backspace Studio. He glues things together for a living.
Apr 11

Rethink. Rebuild. Repeat.

If you’re familiar with Backspace, you know it is a venture studio (est. 2015) for technology entrepreneurs with ideals worth building into impactful companies.

The past months we reviewed our model based on two years of insights. We took these insights and iterated on our model. The most important change? We will help entrepreneurs and companies outside our own portfolio.

What will be different?

From depending on external funding to an actual business model
Raising money automatically comes with a runway. But our mission is long-term. Those two didn’t fit. We wanted to be in control of our runway. So we decided to change our business model. Instead of raising money we will help other companies build digital products in exchange for money. It’s as simple and honest as it sounds.

This change also informs the kind of companies and products we build next. For example: we won’t build products that require a huge user base before it’s able to generate any type of revenue.

From working exclusively on our portfolio to working for other companies as well
Problems worth solving are not exclusive to our portfolio companies. We felt the urge to look outside.

From acting as a co-founder to 0% or 100% ownership
Having 10~35% equity in a company is something that we now call a ‘weird compromise’. We felt responsible, but not necessarily in control. From now on we will either help existing ventures, or build our own.

Our purpose vs. your purpose
Backspace has an open culture that allowed us to have honest conversations. Everyone on our team used the past months to reflect. On a company level but also on a personal level. Unfortunately we couldn’t find a direction which was a fit for everyone. We believe it’s important to do something you love. Even if that means that moving on. We feel blessed to have worked with such brilliant minds. Thanks!

From B.Amsterdam to TQ
Changing our course asked for a change of scenery. In TQ we found a perfect new home in the heart of Amsterdam ♥️

What will stay the same?

Design, traction and technology as our core skills
The triad of design, traction and technology has proven to represent the most essential skill set necessary for building a technology company.

Focus on prototyping
Running sprints, getting people to test our products, shipping even when we know it still needs work. They all proved fruitful ways of validating ideas.

Execution speed
We are better at building than writing reports. We get to a working product faster. That habit won’t change.

Mission and vision
We’d be naive if we would ignore our personal and the world’s needs to bring products to market that make it a better place.

Focus on work culture
Backspace has invested time and resources in culture right from the start, we learned how it truly builds a team’s resilience. It’s an area we’ll keep exploring via our self-initiated projects. *hint hint*

Communications
Our website, Twitter, Instagram, and this Backspace Journal were a joy to work on and a good way to stay in touch with friends and foes.

Curious about more learnings from the past period, or our plans for the future? Signup for our monthly newsletter, or better yet; ping us for a tour of the new office.
